_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:51:59 using v2.1
title: How have waiting times after an urgent referral changed for suspected breast cancer?
analysis_commentary:
We saw in the previous chart that the proportion of people seen within 2 weeks of an urgent referral for breast cancer had decreased 2013/14 Q1 to 2014/15 Q1. Looking at the longer term trend we can see that this has been steadily declining since 2013/14 Q3 and was at its lowest point (92.3%) in 2014/15 Q1.

The total number of people who had an urgent referral for suspected breast cancer has also increased over time and was at its highest of nearly 72,000 in 2014/15 Q1. However, the number of these cases being seen within 2 weeks has actually decreased in 2014/15 Q1 compared to the previous quarter. Combined, these would explain the decrease in proportion we see here. The number of referrals have increased and the number seen within 2 weeks has not increased to match this.
